Lems.description: A number of ComponentTypes for internal use in EDEN.

ComponentType.name: silentSynapse
ComponentType.description: Dummy synapse which emits no current. Used as presynaptic endpoint for analog synaptic connection.

ComponentType.name: linearGradedSynapse
ComponentType.description: Behaves just like a one way gap junction.

ComponentType.name: gradedSynapse
ComponentType.description: Graded/analog synapse. Based on synapse in Methods of http://www.nature.com/neuro/journal/v7/n12/abs/nn1352.html

Parameter.name: delta
Parameter.description: Slope of the activation curve

Parameter.name: k
Parameter.description: Rate constant for transmitter-receptor dissociation rate

Parameter.name: Vth
Parameter.description: The half-activation voltage of the synapse

Parameter.name: erev
Parameter.description: The reversal potential of the synapse

ComponentType.name: alphaCurrentSynapse
ComponentType.description: Alpha current synapse: rise time and decay time are both _tau.

Parameter.name: tau
Parameter.description: Time course for rise and decay

Parameter.name: ibase
Parameter.description: Baseline current increase after receiving a spike

ComponentType.name: alphaSynapse
ComponentType.description: Ohmic synapse model where rise time and decay time are both _tau. Max conductance reached during this time (assuming zero conductance before) is _gbase * _weight.

Parameter.name: tau
Parameter.description: Time course of rise/decay

ComponentType.name: expTwoSynapse
ComponentType.description: Ohmic synapse model whose conductance waveform on receiving an event has a rise time of _tauRise and a decay time of _tauDecay. Max conductance reached during this time (assuming zero conductance before) is _gbase * _weight.

ComponentType.name: expThreeSynapse
ComponentType.description: Ohmic synapse similar to expTwoSynapse but consisting of two components that can differ in decay times and max conductances but share the same rise time.

ComponentType.name: voltageConcDepBlockMechanism
ComponentType.description: Synaptic blocking mechanism which varys with membrane potential across the synapse, e.g. in NMDA receptor mediated synapses

ComponentType.name: tsodyksMarkramDepMechanism
ComponentType.description: Depression-only Tsodyks-Markram model, as in Tsodyks and Markram 1997.

ComponentType.name: tsodyksMarkramDepFacMechanism
ComponentType.description: Full Tsodyks-Markram STP model with both depression and facilitation, as in Tsodyks, Pawelzik and Markram 1998.

ComponentType.name: blockingPlasticSynapse
ComponentType.description: Biexponential synapse that allows for optional block and plasticity mechanisms, which can be expressed as child elements.

ComponentType.name: pulseGeneratorDL
ComponentType.description: Dimensionless equivalent of _pulseGenerator_. Generates a constant current pulse of a certain _amplitude for a specified _duration after a _delay

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before change in current. Current is zero prior to this.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration for holding current at amplitude. Current is zero after delay + duration.

Parameter.name: amplitude
Parameter.description: Amplitude of current pulse

ComponentType.name: sineGenerator
ComponentType.description: Generates a sinusoidally varying current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. The _period and maximum _amplitude of the current can be set as well as the _phase at which to start.

ComponentType.name: sineGeneratorDL
ComponentType.description: Generates a sinusoidally varying current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. The _period and maximum _amplitude of the current can be set as well as the _phase at which to start.

ComponentType.name: rampGenerator
ComponentType.description: Generates a ramping current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. During this time the current steadily changes from _startAmplitude to _finishAmplitude.

ComponentType.name: rampGeneratorDL
ComponentType.description: Generates a ramping current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. During this time the dimensionless current steadily changes from _startAmplitude to _finishAmplitude.

ComponentType.name: voltageClamp
ComponentType.description: Voltage clamp. Applies a variable current _i to try to keep parent at _targetVoltage. Not yet fully tested!!! Consider using voltageClampTriple!!

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before change in current. Current is zero prior to this.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration for attempting to keep parent at targetVoltage. Current is zero after delay + duration.

Parameter.name: targetVoltage
Parameter.description: Current will be applied to try to get parent to this target voltage

Parameter.name: simpleSeriesResistance
Parameter.description: Current will be calculated by the difference in voltage between the target and parent, divided by this value

ComponentType.name: voltageClampTriple
ComponentType.description: Voltage clamp with 3 clamp levels. Applies a variable current _i (through _simpleSeriesResistance) to try to keep parent cell at _conditioningVoltage until time _delay, _testingVoltage until _delay + _duration, and _returnVoltage afterwards. Only enabled if _active = 1.

Parameter.name: active
Parameter.description: Whether the voltage clamp is active (1) or inactive (0).

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before switching from conditioningVoltage to testingVoltage.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration to hold at testingVoltage.

Parameter.name: conditioningVoltage
Parameter.description: Target voltage before time delay

Parameter.name: testingVoltage
Parameter.description: Target voltage between times delay and delay + duration

Parameter.name: returnVoltage
Parameter.description: Target voltage after time duration

Parameter.name: simpleSeriesResistance
Parameter.description: Current will be calculated by the difference in voltage between the target and parent, divided by this value

ComponentType.name: poissonFiringSynapse
ComponentType.description: Poisson spike generator connected to single synapse providing an input current

EventPort.name: spike
EventPort.description: Port on which spikes are emitted

Exposure.name: tsince
Exposure.description: Time since the last spike was emitted

ComponentType.name: transientPoissonFiringSynapse
ComponentType.description: Poisson spike generator with delay and duration connected to single synapse providing an input current. Similar to ComponentType poissonFiringSynapse.

EventPort.name: spike
EventPort.description: Port on which spikes are emitted

Exposure.name: tsince
Exposure.description: Time since the last spike was emitted

ComponentType.name: spikeGenerator
ComponentType.description: Simple generator of spikes at a regular interval set by _period.

Parameter.name: period
Parameter.description: Time between spikes. First spike will be emitted after this time.

Exposure.name: tnext
Exposure.description: When the next spike should ideally be emitted (dt permitting)

ComponentType.name: spikeGeneratorRandom
ComponentType.description: Generator of spikes with a random interspike interval of at least _minISI and at most _maxISI

Parameter.name: maxISI
Parameter.description: Maximum interspike interval

Parameter.name: minISI
Parameter.description: Minimum interspike interval

Exposure.name: isi
Exposure.description: The interval until the next spike

Exposure.name: tnext
Exposure.description: When the next spike should ideally be emitted (dt permitting)

ComponentType.name: spikeGeneratorPoisson
ComponentType.description: Generator of spikes whose ISI is distributed according to an exponential pdf with scale 1/_averageRate

ComponentType.name: spikeGeneratorRefPoisson
ComponentType.description: Generator of spikes whose ISI distribution is the maximum entropy distribution over [_minimumISI, +infinity) with mean 1/_averageRate

ComponentType.name: fixedFactorConcentrationModelTraub
ComponentType.description: Model of buffering of concentration of an ion (currently hard coded to be calcium, due to requirement for _iCa) which has a baseline level _restingConc and tends to this value with time course 1 / _beta. A fixed factor _phi is used to scale the incoming current INDEPENDENTLY OF THE SIZE OF THE COMPARTMENT to produce a concentration change. Not recommended for use in models other than Traub et al. 2005!

ComponentType.name: iafTauCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau

ComponentType.name: iafTauRefCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau. It has a refractory period of _refract after spiking

ComponentType.name: iafCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell with capacitance _C, _leakConductance and _leakReversal

ComponentType.name: iafRefCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell with capacitance _C, _leakConductance, _leakReversal and refractory period _refract

ComponentType.name: izhikevichCell
ComponentType.description: Cell based on the 2003 model of Izhikevich, see http://izhikevich.org/publications/spikes.htm

ComponentType.name: izhikevich2007Cell
ComponentType.description: Cell based on the modified Izhikevich model in Izhikevich 2007, Dynamical systems in neuroscience, MIT Press

ComponentType.name: adExIaFCell
ComponentType.description: Model based on Brette R and Gerstner W (2005) Adaptive Exponential Integrate-and-Fire Model as an Effective Description of Neuronal Activity. J Neurophysiol 94:3637-3642

DerivedVariable.name: iMemb
DerivedVariable.value: -1 * gL * (v - EL) + gL * delT * exp((v - VT) / delT) - w + iSyn

ComponentType.name: fitzHughNagumo1969Cell
ComponentType.description: The Fitzhugh Nagumo model is a two-dimensional simplification of the Hodgkin-Huxley model of spike generation in squid giant axons. This system was suggested by FitzHugh (FitzHugh R. [1961]: Impulses and physiological states in theoretical models of nerve membrane. Biophysical J. 1:445-466), who called it " Bonhoeffer-van der Pol model ", and the equivalent circuit by Nagumo et al. (Nagumo J., Arimoto S., and Yoshizawa S. [1962] An active pulse transmission line simulating nerve axon. Proc IRE. 50:2061-2070.1962). This version corresponds to the one described in FitzHugh R.[1969]: Mathematical models of excitation and propagation in nerve. Chapter 1 (pp. 1-85 in H.P. Schwan, ed. Biological Engineering, McGraw-Hill Book Co., N.Y.)

Parameter.name: I
Parameter.description: plays the role of an external injected current

StateVariable.name: V
StateVariable.description: V plays the role of the membrane potential

StateVariable.name: W
StateVariable.description: W plays the role of a recovery variable

ComponentType.name: fitzHughNagumoCell
ComponentType.description: Simple dimensionless model of spiking cell from FitzHugh and Nagumo. Based on http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/FitzHugh-Nagumo_model. Note: should be updated, see https://github.com/NeuroML/NeuroML2/issues/42

ComponentType.name: pinskyRinzelCA3Cell
ComponentType.description: Reduced CA3 cell model from Pinsky and Rinzel 1994. See https://github.com/OpenSourceBrain/PinskyRinzelModel

ComponentType.name: IF_curr_alpha
ComponentType.description: Leaky integrate and fire model with fixed threshold and alpha-function-shaped post-synaptic current

ComponentType.name: IF_curr_exp
ComponentType.description: Leaky integrate and fire model with fixed threshold and decaying-exponential post-synaptic current

ComponentType.name: IF_cond_alpha
ComponentType.description: Leaky integrate and fire model with fixed threshold and alpha-function-shaped post-synaptic conductance

ComponentType.name: IF_cond_exp
ComponentType.description: Leaky integrate and fire model with fixed threshold and exponentially-decaying post-synaptic conductance

ComponentType.name: EIF_cond_exp_isfa_ista
ComponentType.description: Adaptive exponential integrate and fire neuron according to Brette R and Gerstner W (2005) with exponentially-decaying post-synaptic conductance

DerivedVariable.name: voltage_rate_active
DerivedVariable.value: (MVOLT * ((-1 * ((v / MVOLT) - v_rest) + delta_I) / tau_m + (i_offset - w) / cm) / MSEC) + (iSyn / (cm * NFARAD))

ComponentType.name: EIF_cond_alpha_isfa_ista
ComponentType.description: Adaptive exponential integrate and fire neuron according to Brette R and Gerstner W (2005) with alpha-function-shaped post-synaptic conductance

DerivedVariable.name: voltage_rate_active
DerivedVariable.value: (MVOLT * ((-1 * ((v / MVOLT) - v_rest) + delta_I) / tau_m + (i_offset - w) / cm) / MSEC) + (iSyn / (cm * NFARAD))

ComponentType.name: HH_cond_exp
ComponentType.description: Single-compartment Hodgkin-Huxley-type neuron with transient sodium and delayed-rectifier potassium currents using the ion channel models from Traub.

ComponentType.name: expCondSynapse
ComponentType.description: Conductance based synapse with instantaneous rise and single exponential decay (with time constant tau_syn)

ComponentType.name: expCurrSynapse
ComponentType.description: Current based synapse with instantaneous rise and single exponential decay (with time constant tau_syn)

ComponentType.name: alphaCondSynapse
ComponentType.description: Alpha synapse: rise time and decay time are both tau_syn. Conductance based synapse.

ComponentType.name: alphaCurrSynapse
ComponentType.description: Alpha synapse: rise time and decay time are both tau_syn. Current based synapse.

ComponentType.name: SpikeSourcePoisson
ComponentType.description: Spike source, generating spikes according to a Poisson process.
